title: How to find my text message history on Verizon phones - Quora

response.answer_text: If you deleted the messages from your phone it's possible to recover them but can be difficult. Unfortunately (or fortunately for privacy's sake) Verizon doesn't keep records of the actual texts, only who and when they were sent/received. Android phones and iPhones have different recovery processes. The only way I've ever heard of to recover deleted messages from an android is to use an app that connects the phone to a computer. This article explains the process: How to Recover Deleted Text Messages on Android Phones iPhones can be a little easier if they were set up right. But possible regardless. This article outlines three different ways to recover texts from iPhone: How to recover deleted text messages on iPhone It can be work, but if the texts are important it's worth it. Good luck!

On my Samsung S6 I just touch the “Messages+” icon, then it takes me to all of the conversations that I’ve had. I suspect that answer is too simple for you and you’ve already gone through those steps to no avail. If you can tell me what type of Verizon phone you have, I might be able to give you a better answer.
